questions.text: What is the PROPER spelling of the name pronounced 'Fee-bee'?
Now I'll give you some sentences (taken from actual 'Friends' quizzes), and you tell me what is wrong with them. First one: Who sings the friends theme song?
questions.explanation:
Missing capital and quotations.

	It should be - Who sings the 'Friends' theme song?

questions.text: What did Pheobe call her mothers hobbie of erotic pottery?
questions.explanation:
Spelling and punctuation.

	It should be - What did Phoebe call her mother's hobby of erotic pottery?

questions.text: What was Monica's dog's name when she was child?
questions.explanation:
Missing word.

	It should be - What was Monica's dog's name when she was a child?

questions.text: In the one with the stripper, what did the stripper not steal but Joey thought she had,it was on Joey's bedside table when Joey slept with the stripper?
questions.explanation:
Capitalization, grammar, punctuation, run-on sentence.

	It should be something like - In 'The One With The Stripper', what didn't the stripper steal, although Joey thought she had stolen it? It was on Joey's bedside table while Joey slept with the stripper.

questions.text: Although it wasn't the funniest one I,ve seen, it definitely had it's moments!
questions.explanation:
Punctuation.

	It should be - Although it wasn't the funniest one I've seen, it definitely had its moments!

questions.text: How many misspelled words are in the following sentence - What does Pheobe hope is NOT in her appartment?
Is the first word of this sentence spelled correctly? - Who's farm was Ross told his dog went to?
What channel did Joey and Ross see the special on jellyfish?
questions.explanation:
Grammar.

	It should be - On which channel did Joey and Ross see the special on jellyfish?

questions.text: Is this sentence grammatically correct? - What color was Phoebe's outfit she was wearing at Central Perk?
questions.explanation:
No.

	It should be - What color was the outfit that Phoebe was wearing at Central Perk?

questions.text: This is a run-on sentence. Correctly punctuated, how many sentences should it form? - What did Monica leave in the hotel room when she stayed with Chandler, but the hotel called and one of the Friends got the message by accident, it was in Chandler's hotel room, but was something feminine?
questions.explanation:
3.

	It should be - What did Monica leave in the hotel room when she stayed with Chandler? The hotel called and one of the Friends got the message by accident. It was in Chandler's hotel room, but was something feminine.

questions.text: What is Monica's parent's nickname for her?
questions.explanation:
Punctuation.

	It should be - What is Monica's parents' nickname for her?

questions.text: Who does the gang poke with a stick to see if he was alive?
questions.explanation:
Verb tense and subject-pronoun agreement.

	It should be - Whom does the gang poke with a stick to see if he is alive?

questions.text: The one with Joey's porche? [Editor's note-"porche" refers to a make of car.]
questions.explanation:
Sentence fragment, spelling and capitalization.

	It's a sentence fragment because it doesn't have a verb. In addition, correct spelling is 'Porsche.'

questions.text: Easy question for the last one! True or false? English grammar is only important to picky people and teachers. It isn't something teens should have to worry about.
